Metadata.Title: All Access Is Denied by Default
Metadata.DirectLink: All Access Is Denied by Default

Content.Data:
==Applies To==
* Web Applications
==What to Check For==
Check that all access is denied by default in web server settings and in authorization code.
==Why==
Denying all access by default assures that only explicitly authorized access is possible.
==How to Check==
To make sure all access is denied by default:
# **Enumerate all sensitive pages.** Make a list of all pages that handle sensitive or private information. # **Verify that all access is denied by default on the web server.** Examine the web server configuration to make sure that all access is denied by default unless explicitly authorized. # **Verify that all access is denied by default in authorization code.** Review your application's authorization code to make sure that all access is denied by default.
==How to Fix==
To deny all access by default:
# **Enumerate all sensitive pages.** Make a list of all pages that handle sensitive or private information. # **Configure web-server authorization.** Configure the web-server to deny all access by default for all locations that contain sensitive pages or data. The exact procedures are different for different web servers - please, refer to your web server's documentation for detailed instructions on configuring its access control settings. # **Deny all access by default in your authorization code.** Implement authorization in your application to deny all access by default.
